intro: Gothofreda fournieriana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. The flowers, which come in a variety of colors, are pollinated primarily by insects such as bees and butterflies.
